resource.chars:
A Section of a Coal Country in Somersetshire about 20 Mile from South East to North West 

South East Chalk Hills.  Fig. I Mendip hill. North West Yellow okre & Lapis Calamineris. Lead mines. Red oker.

Red Earth or Malm. Coal Clives. Stinking Vein about 2 feet thick. Cathead Vein 2 feet 1/2 thick. Three Coal Vein 3 feet thick. Peacock or Peau Vein 2 feet. Smith Coal Vein. Shelly Vein. 10 Inch Vein.

Lyas or Limestone Marle. Yellowish Earth. A Ridg of Rubble, Clay &c: Breaking ye course of ye Veines & making them step up or down sometimes not a foot thick & Sometimes Continuing some Miles.

Red Earth. Cliffs. Stinking Vein. Three Coal Vein. Peau Vein 2 feet Thick. Smith Coal Vein. Shelly Vein. Ten Inch Vein.

A Section of the same Country from North <s>West<\s> East to S.<s>E<\s>W. on the drift or Level
of the Coal and at right Angles with the former,

South West. Lead mines. Limestone. Red Earth or Malm. Coal Clives. Lyas or Limestone. Marle. Yellowish Earth. Red Earth. Coal Clives. 

North East. Chalk hills. Freestone.
